title: Every team has that one Mumen Rider

replies.body: {{champion:36}}  0/30 mundo goes where 0/30 mundo pleases
Mumen Rider is a true hero.
3v5? IDC I logged in to play league, not ff at 20
They'll have to earn that victory from my cold dead hands :D
HERE HERE
Amen to that!
Says the support taking on the whole enemy team in a heroic last stand
{{champion:44}} _**PENTAKILL**_
I once played a game with a Taric Quadra. He wouldn't kill me cause we got along pretty well lol

{{champion:222}}{{champion:150}}{{champion:37}}{{champion:90}} "Yi, don't 1v5 their entire team!!"

{{champion:11}} "BUT MUH PENTA THOU!!"
1% of the time it works all the time.
As a sleeper yi main this is true.

People focus on his defeats, but that guy's racked up a shit load of assists and objectives.

Mumen Rider is a true support main.

> [{quoted}](name=tombdragon,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=x2mZXtee,comment-id=0012,timestamp=2016-02-03T03:40:43.255+0000)
>
> People focus on his defeats, but that guy's racked up a shit load of assists and objectives.
> 
> Mumen Rider is a true support main.

You heard Saitama: he only won so easily because he ks'd.

I report those people.

As if they haven't donated 20 kills to the enemy team by themselves alone, they keep their teammates-and in extend the enemies who like fair sportsmanship-captive in the games they ruin.
sportsmanship is not something someone who doesn't play with mumen riders have.

wtf?

In this post, it may be funny, but having someone like that on your team is just a miserable experience. It ruins the game for everyone else unless they are all in on it too.

How is living without giving up wasteful? IF anything more people shouldn't assume defeat so soon.

Many times I've seen a game end in champion select but it didn't make me just AFK at base.
...what in the fuck are you even talking about? I said nothing about that.

I was speaking in terms of the tag line not just you. You replied to a comment of sportsmanship pretty much saying it wasn't welcome unless it's a joke.

Not giving up shouldn't be seen as a miserable experience.

It's not about sportsmanship or the like. 

The thread title is "every team has that one mumen rider" (one player on the team), and the character is specifically saying "I have to fight you here and now, even if I don't stand a chance". 

That's like the definition of a feeder, a singular player who initiates lost fights continually, despite knowing that they will lose. Hell, that's intentional feeding, because they are aware that they will lose, and they willingly engage losing scenarios (i.e. running at towers and attacking them at level 1; going straight into a 5-man enemy team by yourself and just spamming abilities; etc.) 

The sportsmanship involved in that is BAD sportsmanship, ruining the game for others.

Yeah but you miss understand the point of the thread, the thread is signifying the guy who keeps on fighting like Mumen Rider not the guy that unintentionally helps the enemy team.

Mumen isn't trying to lose he's trying his best to win even thought his chances are small. That's the point of the thread not a feeder. I can see how you misunderstood it but just look at the comments and the OP's, you've just read the post out of content, no big deal.

Except Mumen Rider would have died had it not been for Saitama. 

Is Saitama in League? No.

"Mumen Rider" players are feeders. There is no Saitama to save them.

Anyone can be a Mumen Rider, it doesn't matter who. it's a mind set, not a person who is under powered and feeding. 

The point of the post is that it doesn't matter who it is issuing the challenge, just that they're doing the best that they can with what they have. They may not win. but they're going to put up a final stand. Doesn't always mean you fed that game.

In the game of League, the mindset of an individual who says "I'm going to fight my opponent no matter what, not even if I will lose to them" IS the mindset of an underpowered feeder. 

There's a reason why the OP used Mumen Rider, instead of generic anime character who says "I will never give up!" Mumen Rider is the characterization of an underpowered individual who picks fights that they know they will lose. Every feeder has that mindset, in some way.

So a support trying to hold down the Nexus while everyone is dead is automatically a feeder?

Hmm yeah, ok yeah, you have no idea what you're talking about.

Using a niche scenario to construct a strawman argument in order to dismiss someone else's argument? 

Hmm yeah, ok yeah, you have no idea what you're talking about.

Learn to argue a point without resorting to ad hominem.

You missed the actual point of the post, clearly nobody ever does anything wrong in-game, right? Get over it. No one cares if you didn't understand this one thread.

LoL By your logic that is true, not to mention that isn't a niche senario, anyone defending a position or being forced into a fight with the enemy and not just standing around dying is what the OP is referring too.

Dude, it went over your head, get over it, no one cares if you didn't understand this one thread.

You're free to look at it that way, but you also have to look at the circumstances. The player may be slightly behind, but that doesn't mean they want to feed. it doesn't mean they're charging in blindly. And Mumen doesn't charge in picking fights, Mumen knew he didn't stand a chance against The Deep SeaKing, and he knew there wasn't a whole lot he could do. But still he did his best, to keep all those innocent people alive. To buy time for someone who could come and help. And if to you is someone who is unworthy of being on your team. then I welcome them every game, because I don't care if I win every time, as long as you try your best, and be the best Mumen Rider, never give up, and play your heart out.

That doesn't make someone a feeder, just because he lost the fight, he won his team a tactical advantage, and I'm saddened you refuse to see that, instead of worshiping the true winner.

Were not talking about giving up were talking about the person who feeds Riven first blood then teleports back to lane and initiates onto her inside her creep wave.

Edit: While she's full health

Again the post talks about a guy being forced into a fight. I think the issue here is people reading the thread differently. 

I read it as, a guy who lost lane and pretty much cost his team the game not giving up and fixing his errors, you read it as a feeder feeding, which it isn't about.

> [{quoted}](name=Knalxz,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=x2mZXtee,comment-id=0002000000010000,timestamp=2016-02-03T01:34:57.182+0000)
>
> How is living without giving up wasteful? IF anything more people shouldn't assume defeat so soon.
> 
> Many times I've seen a game end in champion select but it didn't make me just AFK at base.

There's a difference between not giving up and getting into fights where you're completely certain to lose them. The picture in the OP is talking about a 0/5 Riven trying to take on a 10/0 Mundo because for some reason they think it's a good idea to fight with literally 0 chance of victory.

If you're the sort of person who hates giving up when behind then you should hate people like that, because they're the sort of people that make comebacks impossible.

If you pointing to the OP then it's different, the post talks about being forced into a fight and not trying to worm out of it but facing a greater threat.

The post literally says "I HAVE to fight you here and now!" not I'm fighting you to make a point.
JUSTICE CRASH!!!!
Upvote for One Punch Man :D
More like every team NEEDS a mumen rider

Never give up trust your instincts.
Unless it involves you going into a 1v5

Report Mumen Rider for feeding.

God damn C class heroes.
same
Gotta make the plays. Leesyndrome Pow! Pow!
Triggered
becareful with where you post your one punch man pictures your last one with the ok was relevent to gameplay, but this is more akin to a meme

The feels.

{{sticker:zombie-nunu-tears}}

I will never give up even thought I died so many time.

it life... you suppose to....

#NEVER GIVE UP !!!
This is how bronze elo support feels when it's time to pay for the team's mistakes or screening for an objective.

I hope you aren't implying that his persistence is bad.

Mumen Rider is best hero
Guys, come oooooooon, don't woooooooorry, I can TOTALLY GET THEIR ADC, I JUST NEED TO CHASE THEM THROUGH JU-PLGFT! (Me, every time I play an assassin. I don't play assassins anymore.)

Guilty as charged. But not brainlessly. I do it from time to time (usually if I play top) and the enemy top laner won a duel by a masterfull play or simply outsmarting me. Usually those things end with friendly jabber in chat and honor on both sides.
